es.csic.iiia.nsm.norm.generation.cbr

Class CBRNormGenerationMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.csic.iiia.nsm.norm.generation.cbr.CBRNormGenerationMachine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NormGenerationMachine

    public class CBRNormGenerationMachine
extends java.lang.Object
implements NormGenerationMachine
    A norm generation machine that uses Case Based Reasoning (CBR) to generates norms from conflicts. Each generated norm is aimed to regulate the given conflict, trying to prevent it from happening again in the future
    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"
    See Also:
    Goal, Conflict

    • Method Detail

      • generateNorms

        public java.util.List<Norm> generateNorms(Conflict conflict,
                                          DomainFunctions dmFunctions,
                                          Goal goal)
        Generates norms from a given conflict using Case Based Reasoning (CBR). The method works as follows:
        1. it creates a new CaseDescription for the given conflict;
        2. it searches into the CaseBase for a Case that has a similar CaseDescription;
        3. then, it may happen two things: that a similar case is found, or it is not:
          if it finds a similar Case, then it adapts its best solution to solve the new Conflict.
          Otherwise, if no similar case has been found, it generates a random solution to solve the new CaseDescription, namely the new conflict. Thus, the conflict should be avoided in the future.
        Specified by:
        generateNorms in interface NormGenerationMachine
        Parameters:
        conflict - the conflict to regulate
        dmFunctions - domain-dependent inputs for norm synthesis
        goal - the goal with respect to which generate norms
        Returns:
        a List of norms that are aimed to solve the given conflict
        See Also:
        Conflict, Norm, Goal

      • solveCase

        private CaseSolution solveCase(CaseDescription cDesc,
                               DomainFunctions dmFunctions,
                               Goal goal)
        Creates a new random CaseSolution to solve the conflict described in the CaseDescription. The reasoning employed to generate the random solution is based on the principle: if we prohibit some of the actions that the conflicting agents performed in the situation previous to the conflict, then maybe we can avoid the conflict to happen again. Therefore, the random solution generation works as follows:
        1. it retrieves the conflicting view, namely the View that contains the conflict;
        2. it chooses an agent that is in conflict in the conflicting View;
        3. it retrieves the conflict source, namely the View that describes the situation previous to the conflict;
        4. it retrieves the action that the chosen agent performed in the transition from the conflict source to the conflicting View;
        5. it generates a CaseSolution that prohibits the agent to perform the retrieved action in the situation described by the conflict source View; and
        6. since agents cannot understand case solutions, the generated CaseSolution is translated to norms that will be given to the agents.
        Parameters:
        cDesc - the CaseDescription that describes the conflicting situation
        dmFunctions - the domain functions, which are used to translate case solutions to norms
        goal - the goal with respect to the conflict has been detected
        Returns:
        the new CaseSolution for the case description

      • adaptBestSolution
